column1: * 1917 - J.R.R. Tolkien succumbs to gastritis while at Brocton Camp
column2: and is sent to Brooklands Officers Hospital in Kingston-upon-Hull.

column1: * 1955 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes the Preface to The Ancrene Riwle.
* 1966 - Gene Deitchs wikipedia:Ashcan copy of The Hobbit (1966 film) is shown to a limited audience in New York City.
* 1972 - The Daily Telegraph describes actions of the Forestry Commission as bringing a "Tolkien gloom". Letter 339.
* 1977 - J.R.R. Tolkien: A Biography is published in the US.
